docs.lead_paragraph: DRUG and alcohol abuse ''by our own children'' has reached an ''almost epidemic state,'' Dr. Charles W. Fowler, the superintendent of Hewlett-Woodmere public schools, said in a letter to parents announcing a town meeting to discuss what could be done about the problem. Nearly 600 parents responded, so many in fact that the Nov. 15 meeting had to be moved from the Hewlett High School auditorium to the gymnasium. Dr. Fowler called the gathering ''the largest turnout in the school's history.''
docs.abstract: Dr Charles W Fowler, superintendent of Hewlett-Woodmere public school, says drug and alcohol abuse has reached almost epidemic state among towns' children; nearly 600 parents attended Nov 15 meeting on subject at Hewlett High School gymnasium (M)
